thread.title: This hot new boyband from China is made up entirely of girls
thread.title_full: This hot new boyband from China is made up entirely of girls

author: Yvette Tan
title: This hot new boyband from China is made up entirely of girls
text:
No your eyes are not deceiving you ‚Äî all five members of this Chinese boyband are actually girls.
Acrush is made of five girls who are mostly in their early twenties, with the youngest member being only 18.
SEE ALSO: K-pop girl group celebrates their plastic surgery with before-and-after music videos
The group was formed just last year but have already gained almost 900,000 followers on Chinese social platform Weibo ‚Äî not bad for a band that's not even put out a music video.
Image: ACRUSH/WEIBO
Most of the band's fans are predominantly female, with many calling the band members "husbands" ‚Äî a term usually used to refer to famous male celebrities that they're crushing on.
"I love your style, who needs princess dresses or girly music? This is the way to go," said one netizen on Weibo.
"You guys are really handsome. I'm sure you'll soon become famous," another added.
"The first time I've seen such a good-looking bunch of girls," one said.
#ffcacrush #chinesepop #chinesegirls #idol #kpop #acrush #cpop VMDMFMMSV ‚ù§üåºüå∏üòç
A post shared by @ffc_acrush_ on Mar 28, 2017 at 2:25pm PDT
According to the band manager Zhou , the group avoids using he or she terms, instead using the gender-free term " meishaonian ," meaning handsome youths in Chinese.
Even the "A" in the group's name is manly ‚Äî it stands for Adonis, the Greek god of male beauty.
Image: ACRUSH/WEIBO
The group was formed after their manager begin searching for unisex stars across the country, in light of the success of Li Yuchun, a pop star in China who maintains a rather androgynous style.
Great show of Chris Lee's 2016 Growing Wild Tour in Beijing last night! #liyuchun #chrislee #growingwild #alexanderwang @alexanderwangny
A post shared by Chris Lee ÊùéÂÆáÊò• (@liyuchun.official) on Aug 21, 2016 at 4:43am PDT
After some six months of searching, Lu Keran, An Junxi, Peng Xichen, Min Junqian and Lin Fan were announced as the five members of Acrush.
According to Lu, she's kept her hair short since she was young, and frequently got mistaken for a boy when going into women's restrooms growing up.
The group is officially called "FFC-Acrush" as they're part of a sports brand called the Fantasy Football Confederation , an organisation which trains artists and "develops idols."
All bands under the FFC have to learn to play soccer, and incorporate the sport into their performances.
The band is expected to release their debut video in April. We can't wait.
